channel.title: 2.3 Product Rule on Calculus Hub
channel.description: Recent content in 2.3 Product Rule on Calculus Hub

item.title: 2.3 Examples
item.description:
2.3 Product Rule: Examples

Ex1.

Differentiate \( f(x) = x^3 \cdot (4x - 2) \)

Solution:

We define \( u(x) = x^3 \) and \( v(x) = 4x - 2 \).

  1. Differentiate \( u(x) = x^3 \):
    \( u'(x) = 3x^2 \)

  2. Differentiate \( v(x) = 4x - 2 \):
    \( v'(x) = 4 \)

Now apply the product rule:

\[ f'(x) = u'(x) \cdot v(x) + u(x) \cdot v'(x) \]\[ f'(x) = (3x^2) \cdot (4x - 2) + (x^3) \cdot 4 \]

Simplifying:

item.title: 2.3 Practice
item.description:
2.3 Product Rule: Practice

Ex1.

Differentiate \( f(x) = (x^2 + 3x) \cdot (x^3 - 5) \)

Solution

We define \( u(x) = x^2 + 3x \) and \( v(x) = x^3 - 5 \).

  1. Differentiate \( u(x) = x^2 + 3x \):
    \( u'(x) = 2x + 3 \)

  2. Differentiate \( v(x) = x^3 - 5 \):
    \( v'(x) = 3x^2 \)

Now apply the product rule:

\[ f'(x) = u'(x) \cdot v(x) + u(x) \cdot v'(x) \]\[ f'(x) = (2x + 3) \cdot (x^3 - 5) + (x^2 + 3x) \cdot (3x^2) \]

Simplifying:
